subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * In Korean {{w|hanja}}, the bottom component [[者#Translingual|者]] is written with an additional {{l|mul|丶}} stroke above {{l|mul|日}}, which is the form found in the historical {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}. * Two {{w|CJK Compatibility Ideographs}} exist at U+FA5F and U+2F99F. The former corresponds to the alternative Japanese form with an additional {{l|mul|丶}} stroke above {{l|mul|日}} while the latter corresponds to the alternative Korean form without an additional {{l|mul|丶}} stroke above {{l|mul|日}}.

subSections.title: Related characters
subSections.text: * {{l|mul|[[着]]}} ''(Preferred form used in Hong Kong and mainland China for Pronunciation 1 and 2 in Chinese)''
